intro: Gymnogramma dealbata, commonly known as the silver fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are often covered in a silvery or whitish coating, giving it its common name. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in countries such as Brazil and Mexico. Its fronds are typically evergreen and can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. Gymnogramma dealbata thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories.
